titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 272: Specchio de coscienza

notesStmt.note: Colophon (f. 81v): Finitum die XXI aprilis 1466 per me miserum Andream et indignum sacerdotem filium Bartoli de Lunigiana rure dicta Stagnone.

Cover in very poor condition. Leather badly deteriorated; upper cover board completely detached, lower board loose. Front endleaf detached. Stains on upper and outer edge of most leaves. Some indications of worm damage.

Saint Antoninus wrote three treatises that comprise the Confessional. This Italian text is original, not translated from Latin. Its earliest impression is Italy, unknown town and printer, dated 1472 (See notes of bookseller Jacques Rosenthal on file in the Library).
Inscription on verso of back flyleaf: "Iste liber est meus presbiter Domenico de Mairis."

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Text of a Confessionale in Italian by Saint Antoninus, in the form ending "la dicta età" (in this manuscript spelled "alla detta eta"). Some leaves at the beginning are missing. At the end (f. 81v) are 13 lines of a "Missa pro morbo evitando."
msContents.textLang: Italian, with short "Missa" text at end in Latin

msItem.title: Specchio de coscienza
msItem.colophon: Colophon (f. 81v): Finitum die XXI aprilis 1466 per me miserum Andream et indignum sacerdotem filium Bartoli de Lunigiana rure dicta Stagnone.

supportDesc.extent: 81 leaves : 209 x 143 (139 x 73) mm. bound to 210 x 140 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, i (parchment) + 81 + i (parchment); [1-81]; modern foliation in pencil, lower right recto.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 26 long lines; ruled in drypoint.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a humanistic script by Andreas son of Bartolus de Lunigiana (colophon, f. 81v).

keywords.term: Confession--Catholic Church--Handbooks, manuals, etc.--Early works to 1800
